bug.short_desc: IMAP copy actions, can't stop or interrupt/pause action, no multitasking

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: - Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101208 Lightning/1.0b2 Thunderbird/3.1.7
There is no button to stop/interrupt/pause any IMAP copy process. I cannot see the progress (like in Kmail). The action stops, if I start working in other folders/other tabs (no multitasking).
I need a simple but clear interface for IMAP copy actions, and that it does not stop while doing other stuff with Thunderbird.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. mark a huge number of mails in IMAP folder (extern) 2. rightclick 'copy to' local folder (any) 3. try to stop the progress! (you can't I think) 4. start any action in 3rd folder on other tab, leave the anterior process. 5. you recognize the copy process does not work anymore (though Thunderbird is a bit sluggy) Actual Results: I started the same again and left Thunderbird working .... .... ... ....
